title: remove commas from annotations before use in miRCat
body:
Not sure which is the best way. Either a warning stating they exist in the start.

Or some filter that swaps them in the run.

title: Produce a global list with the novel sequences serialized based on the run
body:
novelXXXX 

After miRCat list them all and serialize them with a uniq ID

title: Details of result expand container beyond parent size
Memory exceeded with a big number of reads
body:
Finding sequences in a file can take to much time with grep.

Implement --> grep -wf $novelSeq $noncons > $novelTmp  in python with hash maps or dictionaries

title: Rerwite count abundance in python - Bash version with grep is to inefficient
body: Does the job with multiple cores but is a waste of resources can be done why more efficiently in python.

title: Doesn't detect conserved reads if the path contains the string "_mirbase"
body:
This occurs with some frequency if people test different databases for conserved reads.
They tend to call the project xxx_mirbase this them interferes down downstream with a regular expression that is way to greedy and does a replace string in the wrong place of the path. 

Detected in "scripts/filter_genome_mirbase.sh" check it occurs in others, but I expect it to be contained to this script.

title: Problems with ViennaPackage dependencies for linux in workbench
body:
RNAfold
RNAplot
--> Compile from source https://www.tbi.univie.ac.at/RNA/#download

randfold --> compile from https://github.com/erbon7/randfold

Once all three files are in /usr/local/bin/ symlinks them to the path  
```
  .Software/srna-workbenchV4.0Alpha/ExeFiles/linux/
```
